description: Non-functional requirements and quality attributes for Glint3D

error_handling.graceful_degradation: Fallback to lower quality on resource constraints
error_handling.error_recovery: Scene state preserved on non-critical failures

data_integrity.scene_serialization: Lossless round-trip for all supported formats
data_integrity.transaction_safety: Atomic operations with rollback on failure

accessibility.screen_readers: ARIA labels on all interactive elements

user_experience.error_messaging: Human-readable error descriptions with suggested actions
user_experience.undo_redo: Unlimited history for all user operations

data_protection.asset_sandboxing: All file access bounded by asset root

network_security.no_external_dependencies: Engine core has no network access
network_security.cors_compliance: Proper origin validation for web embedding

privacy.no_telemetry: No usage tracking without explicit consent
privacy.local_storage: Scene data never leaves user device by default
privacy.anonymization: Share links contain no personally identifiable information

code_quality.static_analysis: Zero warnings on highest warning level
code_quality.documentation: All public APIs have JSDoc/Doxygen comments

architecture.interface_stability: Semantic versioning for all public APIs
architecture.dependency_management: Pinned versions for all external dependencies

ai_maintainability.intent_coverage: All user workflows expressible via SDK intents
ai_maintainability.schema_validation: All operations validated against machine-readable schemas
ai_maintainability.change_isolation: Local changes don't require understanding entire codebase
